bboxes.raw_text:
iginated the recipe for making
ice cream. Several countries
claim the honor, but an enter
prising man In St. Louis, Mis-
souri, first served ice cream on
a cone. His experiment serving
scoops of delicious ice cream on
wafered cakes of cylindrical
shape started an entirely newin-
dustry. In fact two businesses
arose from his brainchild.


Ice cream plants grew and
Ice cream cone plants also be-
gan. Today we have many kinds
of ways to serve Ice cream, the
sandwich, the cup, the popsicle
and the sundae, however, none
has usurped the number one po-
sition of the cone.


Ice cream making has come a
long way since the St. Louis Ex-
position days Of the past century
when the cone made its debut.
Gone are the endless hours of
cranking the handle on the anti
quated freezer. Today, count
less man hours are saved by
machines which produced thou
sands of gallons of the tasty
dessert. The favorite flavors
made for the discriminating taste
of the millions of ice cream To-
vers in the United States range
from toffee to the all time favor
lite vanilla.


Sherbets and ices are eaten
more, but no one will dispute
that vanilla, choc olate and straw
berry remain the three top SELL
erS In the ice cream business.


l can see the pleasant days of
my childhood now--We would look
forward to summer because that
was ice cream making time.
About once a week the Ice cream
freezer would come out Of the
basement. We would have the
cream and eggs ready. The bag
of Ice cream salt would be open
and the ice would be Clipped
ready to pack around the clumsy
machine.


My cousin Billie and | we're
given the honors as expert turn
ers. We worked eagerly and
efficiently, knowing that our re-
ward would be scraping the inside
Of the cream holder.


1t seemed an eternity before
our arms cramped and the velvety
Ice cream was ready to be served.
No one had to be cajoled into TAX
Ing a second helping. There was
always beautiful yellow cake or
white cake as the companion dish.
Sometimes we would have apple
pie with scoop of cream on the
side.


When was a wee girl, new
ice cream treat was devised. The
Eskimo Pie was the rage and the
originator Of the pie must have
made a million from the kids In
my neighborhood alone. The pie
was not a pie but we did not have
time to distinguish between pie
or a non pie.


The Eskimo on the label made
many Of US believe that the parka
wearing inhabitants Of the frigid
zone ate Ice cream. We saved
our sticks for prizes.


Do you remember the pies7
They we're a rectangular piece Of
vanilla Ice cream dipped In
chocolate. Later a stick was
added, but eating the pie was
a challenge, especially when the
melting point had been reached.


Popsicles we're excellent ways
to get cool on a hot and humid
Hoosier summers day. The
popsicle seemed cooler, even If
most of It dripped on the ground.

Siq hts and Sounds
ELOtSE BANKS
Ice Cream Time

Modern ice cream stores have
many refreshing containers of
ice cream wonders to satiate your
appetite. If you haven visited an
ice cream store lately--get out
and discover a different world of
Ice cream varieties made with
dates, nuts, coffee, berries,
cakes, candies and marshmal-
lows. You can have Beatle-nut,
Steverino, or even Daquiri fla
vors.


Our favorite here at 2l37 E.
Broadway Road remains French
vanilla. Vive la vanillal

Today Negroes living their retirement
although the percentage still
important.


Since the majority of Negro workers employed
skilled and semised fields retirement
plans are of lower value.


One Of the problems facing place


few have been able
older taxes and monthly utility bills
rerees the Negro face dual problem housing area
Many have the modern retirement
Others unable pay rising they
high.


While so much is being directed toward problems
and the dropouts think that energies
to the hundreds of retired and retired
groups who are in great numbers in city and


The downtown should
the oldsers could and relax
retrees activities should be included
Guiding civic auditorium and hall.
would be feasible for
biliy by bus


While convention hall civic being planned
let's remember that hundreds elderly
who need places for recreation library
center should be located in the downtown area,


feel that of the plans developing
pointed the north end without much
southern

Edward Banks
